title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade pitcher Jordan Hicks and prospect David Sandlin to the White Sox.
White Sox send minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl and some cash to the Red Sox.
Hicks, acquired in 2025, struggled in Boston with an 8.20 ERA over 18.2 innings.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Ben Stas captured the first day of the Something in the Way music festival at Roadrunner.
The festival features two dozen indie bands, including The Hotelier, Tigers Jaw, and Angel Du$t.
Bands like Her New Knife and Explosions in the Sky performed on the first day of the event.

title: Patriots fullback Jack Westover says his sister bet Super Bowl LX matchup in training camp
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots fullback Jack Westover's sister bet $5 on a Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup in August.
Westover's sister's successful bet will payout $18,000, which she placed before the NFL season started.
Jack Westover, a Washington native, will play with the Patriots against the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX on Feb. 8.

title: Watch: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye address crowd at Patriots’ send-off rally
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel and quarterback Drake Maye spoke at the team's Super Bowl send-off rally in Foxborough.
Drake Maye, recovering from an illness and shoulder injury, expressed gratitude to fans during the rally.
The Patriots will play against the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium on February 8.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Alexander Skarsgård hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Alexander Skarsgård hosted the 1,000th episode of 'Saturday Night Live' on January 31, with Cardi B as the musical guest.
The episode featured appearances by Skarsgård's father, Stellan Skarsgård, and former 'SNL' star Pete Davidson.
Despite the milestone, the show maintained a regular format without special celebrations or recognitions.

title: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and dreamed of running the Red Sox
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Mike Macdonald, a Scituate native, is the current head coach of the Seattle Seahawks.
Macdonald dreamed of becoming the Red Sox general manager before switching focus to football coaching.
Since 2024, Macdonald has led the Seahawks to a 24-10 record and a Super Bowl appearance.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots hold send-off rally at Gillette Stadium ahead of Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks.
Robert Kraft, Mike Vrabel, and team captains spoke; Dropkick Murphys performed before the team departure.
Patriots are underdogs with Seahawks favored by 4.5 points in Super Bowl LX on February 8, 2026.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Cornerback Carlton Davis praises the New England Patriots as a top destination for free agents.
Davis highlights coach Mike Vrabel's player-friendly approach and impactful leadership in New England.
Potential 2026 free agents include George Pickens, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams, with a four-year, $104 million contract, ranks eighth among the Patriots' top free-agent signings.
Williams logged 5.5 sacks this season and has been crucial in the Patriots' run to Super Bowl LX.
His defensive prowess includes six quick pressures in the postseason, trailing only Aaron Donald in this stat.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to pursue major trades before deadline, focusing on roster additions addressing big man needs.
Potential trade targets include Nets' Nic Claxton and Mavericks' Daniel Gafford, considering Celtics' defensive priorities.
Celtics also interested in Kings' guard Keon Ellis despite strong competition, given Ellis' impressive shooting and defensive stats.
